website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon D7200 is a great camera for the money, as long as you don't care about an extensive feature set.
pros: Great photo quality, solid performance and a sturdy body are the Nikon D7200's highlights
cons: Subpar wireless implementation and a fixed LCD display

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera primarily for my wife and our photography business. We have both been using the Nikon D7000 but didn't upgrade when the D7100 came out because it seemed to be an incremental upgrade and not worth the cost, at least at that time. The D7200 on the other hand was quite a jump from our D7000 and we decided to pull the trigger and get one after hearing of the product release. The D7200 has performed perfectly and the jump in low light capabilities helps tremendously. We may not upgrade our second D7000 this year but will definitely be getting another D7200 when we do.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Poor lenses, very complicated, medium heavy
customer_reviews.text: Product really suffers from terrible kit lenses. Low light performance is very poor, worse than my Moto 6. It is medium heavy, so inappropriate for carrying around for long periods of time. The manuals are thick, the controls are complicated, and the learning curve is huge. Nikon simply does not know how to design cameras anymore. They are building severely overcomplicated operating systems comparable to Linux. The entry level models like the D5600 and D3500 are just as bad. This camera is inly appropriate for people who want to dedicate lots of time to education and lots of money to decent lenses.
customer_reviews.author: C. W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to upgrade from my D3300. I though about the D7500 but opted for the D7200 as it was less expensive. Now I am really glad that I chose it over its replacement. The D7200 is a better camera than the D7500 that was meant to replace it. I use it for professional real estate photography and it has performed spectacularly.
customer_reviews.author: FCCM Thomas Lohr

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D7200 Best in the Series
customer_reviews.text: I do candids and portraits. The D7200 offers accurate focus, white balance and flesh tone color balance, exceeding my expectations. I own a D7000, D7100 and this D7200, this is the best of the series. I used the D7200 matched with a Nikkor 85mm f:/1.8 lens on a First Friday Art Walk in low, less than optimal light without flash, taking over 300 shots. Quite an impressive camera, especially considering the affordable price point. As the body includes the focus drive motor, I can still use older Nikkor auto focus lenses or modern AF-S lenses.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Finklestein

customer_reviews.title: Great intermediate pro DX camera
customer_reviews.text: I was deciding between the D7500 and the D7200. What made me go with the D7200 was the availability of a battery grip and the 2 card slots. It has everything I need for real estate photography; bracketing up 9 shots, the battery grip option, sophisticated focus management, motor drive for old lenses, lots of control options on the body and the extra card slot for backup. I only wish that it had the tilt screen like the D7500. This purchase through Amazon resulted in a clean model with 15k actuations. After several weeks of shooting, I’m very happy with it as it looks and functions like a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Mojo Master

customer_reviews.title: It's a Nikon
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It's a Nikon. This is an upgrade to my D80 that died a few years ago. It's very similar to that but much much more. I'm still learning about all the features that it has. If you want a camera that you can use manual features as well as auto, and want your settings at your fingertips instead of hidden in the menu ... this is the one to get. A flip-out LCD screen would be a nice feature to have but, this is the right camera for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mara

customer_reviews.title: The camera is beautiful, feels a lot more substantial than the D7500
customer_reviews.text: Just got it yesterday. The camera is beautiful, feels a lot more substantial than the D7500. I have been testing all the functions including near/far focusing. Everything is spot on. Now the bad news. It was delivered by an unmarked van and was left on the street in front of my house. I get lots of packages (many from Amazon) and they are always left inside the front gate which is very easy to do. I went looking for the camera when I saw the van leave and found it on the street. Kind of scary with an exensive item.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Kunstenaar

customer_reviews.title: Holy Wow from Total beginner Non-photographer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for lower light photos in the recording studio. I didn't care about photography - I know nothing about it - just needed some shots for my business. Now Its becoming a little hobby. The auto everything feature is phenomenal. It took 2 minutes of manual reading and I was getting great shots for the website. The "fun settings" I accidentally stumbled on are pretty trippy cool. Some gear has soul - Like a good tube amp. This one has it.
customer_reviews.author: musician'smusician

customer_reviews.title: Works with almost all lenses
customer_reviews.text: This camera meets the requirements I set. It can operate older manual and AF lenses properly, which many models (including the newer 7500) cannot do. It has good low-light performance, which is useful for shooting smaller-aperture telephoto lenses with higher shutter speed for moving subjects. It has more than enough pixels. It has the cropped frame size, for lower cost and a more-telephoto vision rather than wide-angle, which suits my style. The lens is wide enough and more than long enough for general-purpose use. It would be nice if it focused to a little higher magnification.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: what a great camera. Excellent pictures
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a great camera. Excellent pictures. Only drawback or regret is that the WIFI link built in is garbage. The Wifi must connect to a device and not to your router, so if you want to connect to camera you must drop your connection to your network. What a dumb idea. NFC works with WiFi to turn on and off the connection. you are better off buying a remote for the camera than trying to use a smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: jsumr110

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT camera and a really good value for what you ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Nikon D50 which was about 10 years old. This is a GREAT camera and a really good value for what you get. I love the lens. I previously had two lenses, one 18-55mm and one 55-200mm, and was constantly switching lenses. This camera and 18-140mm lens is very versatile. The camera is fast. The ability to connect via wifi to my iPhone and grab pictures is great. You will love this camera and use it for years.
customer_reviews.author: J Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent DSLR, has all that I wanted. I recommend to read the manual before start using it. There are also good tutorials to watch in YouTube to learn how to set it up and use it. I like all the fixtures it has. Nikon added almost the same functionality that full frame DSLRs comes with. The only thing I do not like is that live view screen is fixed, no tilt!...I like it has two sd cards slots! It does not have 4K video shooting but it has full HD. Very pleased with my Nikon D7200 DSLR. Before buying any lenses learn about what is available and what you need. I prefer to buy single items than bundles!
customer_reviews.author: apineda

customer_reviews.title: Another great Nikon camera good enough for pro work
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice camera for the money and the 18-140 mm zoom is a handy lens to have around. I use the 7200 for professional photography and it does everything I need it to do and love the fast continuous shooting mode for sports. I keep the 18-140 lens on my back up 7000 for snapshots around the house and from my car. I liked that this is the US version not the gray market. It arrived in 3 days which was faster than the vendor had estimated.
customer_reviews.author: venuspaint

customer_reviews.title: ITS A KEEPER
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my copy had Focus issues that I was unable to correct using the in camera "Focus Fine Tuning" method with a Focus Chart and had no choice, but to return it. As big as the camera is, it should have come with built in "Auto Focus Fine Tuning". Instead, I returned the camera and will in the near future go for a Nikon D500 thanks to AMAZON.com. Update: This is my second copy, and there are no issues with the focus; it's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold T. Serrata "Nolo Serrata"

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic Rig!
customer_reviews.text: Last year I purchased a D5300 as my first foray into DSLRs. I loved that camera, and I learned a lot in the year I owned it. My only complaint with the 5300 was the size of the body. It always just felt a bit too small for my hands. When my daughter needed a DSLR for a college photography class I gave her the D5300 (and the 18-55 kit lens it came with) and got myself the D7200. What a fantastic rig, and most definitely a step up from the D5300. I love the size, the battery life, the solid feel of the metal body, and of course, the quality of the images.
customer_reviews.author: BKarno

customer_reviews.title: Great for photography
customer_reviews.text: Lowlight video monster if you don’t mind autofocus. Great for photography. Great battery life. Used for video and shot at 500 iso in practically no light (candle light). Produced high quality HD with practically no noise. By comparison, the second camera used was a gh4, which required an iso of 1600 (almost unusable quality) to capture the same light. Not great autofocus at all for video, but if you are good with manual and don’t need a log profile or high bit recording, this is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Zilic

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when buying used
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this used camera from South Town Camera and it came missing the cap the covers the optional power plug on the bottom of the camera (an important thing to have when shooting in temperamental weather conditions). in addition it came with a battery that doesn't hold a charge whatsoeve, not charging past 1 bar and an aftermarket 'Kastar' battery charger, neither are Nikon brand as mentioned on the page. it's pretty disappointing when you get something then realize you have to buy extra parts just to get it working. I'm extremely disappointed and definitely won't be ordering from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: so any Nikon is a great Nikon. Step up from my 3100 DX format ...
customer_reviews.text: am a Nikon gal, so any Nikon is a great Nikon. Step up from my 3100 DX format camera I currently own. Better controls and easier dials to change shutter speed and aperture. Much heavier than the 3100. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Shultz

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I have my D200 back, only better!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this camera. I wanted something like the old D200 i had for ages but haven’t been able to find anything comparable. If they weren’t all “beginner” DSLR’s the next step was full frame- Something I can’t afford. Then I came across this guy in my research! Reminds me a lot of the D200 only with many improvements and updates. Nice and heavy. Very sturdy and well made. I’d recommend this camera a million times over.
customer_reviews.author: KHenn

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend to someone who wants a great camera without switching ...
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Nikon D5100 and wish I would have done it sooner. The quality of the pictures are very noticeable. Would highly recommend to someone who wants a great camera without switching to a full frame. I was also looking for something that would be great in low lighting and this did the job.
customer_reviews.author: AbbyFernandez

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D7200 Camera is a Good Quality Camera
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to digital, I love this camera. Always used the Canon "AE-1" line in the film days. I have the Nikon D80 as well. Really like the options with the D7200. Very impressive camera. Finally at a price that is affordable. Waited some time to get this model. Very pleased with quality, styling, and features. Great price with the included lens.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Between pro and amateur
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera if you want something more than the basics 3000 or 5000. If you are buying this one you better have very big memory cards, where you could store 1K pics with the 3300 now uou can only take 200, pics quality is that good! Why I rate 4 stars is because this 7000's body is quite heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Martin

customer_reviews.title: Wow.
customer_reviews.text: Such a great camera. I'm an enthusiast and this gives me a great camera to continue to grow. Really just top of the line and well built. I've put it through sub-zero tempuratures as well has extremely hot climates and it's not even fazed. I'll definitely have this camera for the long haul.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great image quality. Top-notch system in every way.
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from a D5100. It is a serious step up but well worth the $$ and the climb up the learning curve. I use it daily for a variety of photographic purposes and have not been disappointed. No regrets whatsoever in the decision to move up. Not necessarily a 'starter' DSLR, but clearly worth consideration simply because the value is there along with the advanced technology.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Flawless performance under demanding conditions.
customer_reviews.text: I could pontificate on, and on, about how great this camera is. I wont. It is. My only complaint is that GPS is is still not built into these cameras. I installed a Foolography bluetooth adapter to add the geotags. I've logged over 7000 miles with this camera in the hard saddlebag of my motorcycle. Hot, dusty, humid, bumpy, and even rainy, conditions. The camera has been flawless. It is about the same size and weight as the previous DX camera bodies (D90) and the controlls will be familiar to Nikon users. I was up to speed very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: jayMac

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D7200 awesome for what I could afford!
customer_reviews.text: Almost a rear later I'm still learning some of the amazing things this camera can do. My sensor got dirty and I was getting spotty pictures. I followed the instructions and how to get it to an authorized Nikon repair facility. Because it was under warranty no charge so I was happy about that. Insuring and mailing the body was pricey though. So, keep your camera as dust free as possible and keep your paperwork.
customer_reviews.author: ChatKat

customer_reviews.title: This camera is AWESOME. Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This camera is AWESOME. Great quality, well built, and loaded with features. Excellent images, with much better images in low light situations.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Love love love my Nikon D7200
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about my new Nikon D7200. I first got a Canon t6 and just wasnt satisfied with the quality of my photos, so I sold the canon n replaced it with Nikon. I wont ever go back to anything brand but Nikon. The photos are superb n the features are so many to list, but you wont regret it, love the feature wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Kid

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mid-level DSLR.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the D7200 and the kit lens. I've been wanting a 7000 series since it was introduced and finally decided it was time to pull the trigger. My only problem is mastering all the controls but I'm making progress. There is however a learning curve to be navigated.
customer_reviews.author: F. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Total junk!
customer_reviews.text: Just kidding. This camera is amazing. Coming from a D90 to this is like night and day. All of the added features, combined with the better sensor performance, makes this camera simply flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Wo kommst du

customer_reviews.title: I am still learning a lot about this camera but absolutely love it. I wish I would have skipped purchasing ...
customer_reviews.text: I went from the Nikon D3200 to the D7200. I am still learning a lot about this camera but absolutely love it. I wish I would have skipped purchasing the D3200 & went for this from the get go. Takes a lot better photos in the low light situations. Have no complaints about this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dacia D.

customer_reviews.title: It was the best choice for me
customer_reviews.text: It was the best choice for me. I am glad I went with the 18mm - 140mm lens. It gives me much more flexibility and matches the quality of the 18mm - 70mm lens I had previously. I definitely would recommend this camera to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Zmijewski Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase!! I went from Nikon D3200 to D7200. That skips a bunch of models and I'm glad that I did. Great focus and low-light camera. Pictures are sharper and this feature (2 card slots) makes it very worthwhile. So many features and menu functions that it will take me a while to learn it all.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Still a great camera
customer_reviews.text: These were taken with a cheap kit lens, 18-55 I think JPEG fine no post production on pink just cropped and other had a little post prod. on windows app. How do they put it, pictures worth a thousand words? Great camera
customer_reviews.author: David Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Upgrading from the Nikon D7000 to the D7200
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the Nikon D7000 and I am happy with the improvement. Sharper, faster focus, lower noise.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Wow, a definite improvement over my well worn D70. Typical Nikon quality with a solid feel. Being able to save jpg and RAW on separate SD cards is a great feature as is being able to use my "old" AI-S Nikkor glass. Looking forward to creating many thousands of images.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Parr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera, and if you're familiar with any companies than you'll know that Nikon is one of the best, if not top 3 in my eyes. Their lens are crystal clear and their products are well built. I would still have mine if not wanting to upgrade to a full frame. If you are in the price range and want a really good camera, than this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Codere

customer_reviews.title: Beyond entry level.
customer_reviews.text: Not your average entry level DSLR- this d7200 is amazing. A big Step from my tiny D3200. I’m very glad I upgraded. The quality is tack sharp, the focus is fast- and if your like me and use Manual it’s nice to have the versatility in a few options to adjust Apature, Shutter, and ISO.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Buesching

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. I upgraded from the D80 and can't ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great camera. I upgraded from the D80 and can't believe I lived in the dark ages. It has more features than the 7500. Double memory card, battery grip, etc. I purchased for video and it will record for about 30 mins before needing to pause. This is due to a sensor overheat protection. Cons: You can't charge the camera from USB/AC power. Only will operate off a battery. Also of note: I got a used, open box that I purchased as new. It was missing the charger for the battery. Amazon offered a discount and gc towards a charger. It was pretty clear the box was opened and used for a wedding/event and returned.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMember

customer_reviews.title: Top-notch stills, video lacks.
customer_reviews.text: This camera has everything you could ask for, but the autofocus on the video is slow definitely not smooth transitioning from one distance to the next. Considering Nikon touted this camera as an advancement in video, it is definitely not a video camera. If you're doing stills, this is definitely the camera for you. Find another option for video, though.
customer_reviews.author: SharePoint Jared

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera -
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera - upgraded from a D5200 - feels just as good in the hand, still getting used to all the features - but overall very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera. Still learning. Jerod Foster book D7200 From Snapshots to Great Shots is an excellent resource. I almost wish I had gone ahead and bought the 7500 but this one was less and a huge leap from my 3100. I don’t regret the step up.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic performance on a recent trip to NYC. Fantastic colors, speed and focus. Upgraded from another Nikon DSLR had for 13 years. High ISO helped me in areas where I couldn’t use a flash. Files are extremely large allowing 20x24 and larger prints.
customer_reviews.author: Stormtrooper_Armor

customer_reviews.title: A bonus is the WIFI works great with Nikon's IOS app as long as you turn ...
customer_reviews.text: Replacement/upgrade from my D7000. Much faster focus and in dimmer light just as others have stated. The IQ is an improvement due to the lack of the AA filter. A bonus is the WIFI works great with Nikon's IOS app as long as you turn on airplane mode. As I've only had it for a short time I still need to find out how to utilize and setup the other functions available. I'm going to keep it!
customer_reviews.author: Ivanq

customer_reviews.title: A Lightweight, Multi-Talented Nikon
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic at what it does. Having used a D800 for the majority of my professional life, I use these cameras as trainers for my students. While you can't expect full frame quality from a crop sensor, the D7200 does a VERY nice job in the speed and sharpness category. Also, I've been impressed at the quality of video this little guy can grab! I've taken to carrying one in my kit as a backup!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Warren

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D7200 is a keeper
customer_reviews.text: Others have given lengthily reviews. Here's what I really like. Extremely bright viewfinder So many customizing choices Quick to take pictures (short shutter release time). Had it for about 3 months now and no problems. Light weight and smaller body size.
customer_reviews.author: Rob&Sue

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was using my beloved Nikon d40 for 10 years and now i get the d7200. Amazing camera! Build construction it's rock solid, great quality, and images are crips and sharp, great tone and dinamic range. Autofocus it's fast an precise. Love timelapse. I'm very happy with this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Sebastián Zahn

customer_reviews.title: Actually the Nikon D7200 is one of the best cameras that I have already bought in this Category
customer_reviews.text: Actually the Nikon D7200 is one of the best cameras that I have already bought in this Category, this camera takes spectacular photos, and Filming it is undoubtedly the best I know in its category. Thank you Amazon for bringing Quality Products at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: ENSA

customer_reviews.title: A professional level DX DSLR for an amateur price
customer_reviews.text: After getting this to replace my broken Nikon D-7100, I am amazed at the low light ability and bright light fast shutter speeds. It uses the exact same body, but the computer and firmware are miles above the D-7100. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Drunk_Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking at this camera for a while. Once my d3300 stopped working in the middle of a job Due to humity (as I was told) I knew it was time to upgrade, I absolutely love this camera! Auto focus is quick and is responsive no matter the lens I have on it. Haven’t used it for much other than portraits.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Still learning how to use this thing. Tons of great tutorials out there but you'll need to practice what you learn. Once you do that it will all be second nature.
customer_reviews.author: Coop

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this camera!
customer_reviews.text: The pictures are amazing!!! Such an upgrade from my other Nikon I have owned the last 4 years. I am super happy I purchased this camera even though it was a little more than what I wanted to spend.
customer_reviews.author: D. Byrne

customer_reviews.title: GREAT EVERYTHING.
customer_reviews.text: I am loving all the features on this camera. I had a Nikon D5000. This has been a great upgrade for me. Can't wait to take it to Europe this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: It has amazing detail in it's images. It does very well in low light. It's very versatile and I always have this with me. the lens it comes with is just ok. I use it for landscape and wildlife. I use this to support my d810.
customer_reviews.author: person

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of equipment... my first upgrade from the D300 so it feels like a real upgrade. Already personalised the two user settings and metadata information. Got it just in time for vacation trips to Barbados and Las Vegas sot it got a great workout right out of the box. I still have to get accustomed to the changed layout and settings but I'm sure that will not be a problem....if only I can learn real Photography now :-). Definitely recommended for DSLR photographers
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely an amateur when it comes to cameras (this is my first DSLR). It was slightly intimidating at first, but this camera is amazing once you get the hang of it. The manual explains everything you would need to know, and there are a plethora of reviews and information available online to help you tweak the settings.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Monster
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera I've ever used. I'm no pro by any means, I'm just an enthusiast that enjoys photography a lot. I don't even consider myself to be good, but this definitely feels great. Feature rich, responsive and fast. Sensitivity is HUGE. I found what seems to be a dead pixels in higher ISO levels without noise reduction, but one in 24 MP is unnoticeable. I haven't tested it thoroughly but it will probably see a ton of violence for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Galíndez

customer_reviews.title: Great for someone looking to upgrade from an entry level dslr!
customer_reviews.text: Such an awesome dslr! Upgraded from a d5200 and was not at all disappointed. Great quality at night, super easy controls, paired with a 35mm 1.8 lens it’s hard to beat. Would highly recommend for anyone looking to step up their photography game or someone like myself who can’t afford to drop the money on a full frame setup.
customer_reviews.author: Jefro H.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE MY CAMERA AND IT IS AWESOME. IVE BEEN USING IT FOR TWO YEARS NOW AND ITS AMAZING.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Willingham

customer_reviews.title: The incredible ease of use !
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera having used and had other Nikons DSLR it’s just as I was execting it to be only better.
customer_reviews.author: Heyward

customer_reviews.title: Great camera great price
customer_reviews.text: I'm learning so this camera has more buttons than I know what to do with but the camera is excellent quality, feels great in your hands it has the grooves for proper holding. Did not have a lense so make sure you get one separately. Picture quality is amazing and the manual that came with it explains so much
customer_reviews.author: FERMIN A SANDOVAL DIAZ

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D7200, 24 MP Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon D7200 has a very good reputation. It is very versatile with many functions available through buttons in lieu of exploring menus. It focuses very fast and can use lenses that do not have auto-focus motors in them because it is contained in the camera body. Shutter speeds can reach 1/8000th of a second. It has multiple continuous modes and all of them are very fast. There are two SD card slots to make sure you never miss a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Willems

customer_reviews.title: I've had 9 different Nikon cameras and this one is the very best one.
customer_reviews.text: This camera has it all and does it all for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Excellent semi-professional camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera. I used it both for photo and video for private and business use. The photos are excellent in day and low light. It does everything as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Raban

customer_reviews.title: I can't see the photo when I take the picture and I did take the photo.
customer_reviews.text: I love Nikon, but this one doesn't seem to never show an image in the back of the camera right after the photo is taken. When I scan thru the pictures, I DID take the photos.
customer_reviews.author: David Patryas

customer_reviews.title: Power Camera
customer_reviews.text: I can’t recommend this camera enough for those who are looking for quick, high quality shots. Very versatile and easy to use. Although, I am on the search for a better lense to fully put those 24 megapixels to work.
customer_reviews.author: Voodoo Coffee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Combo. Just came from a D3300, great camera, but the d7200 is a great upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Mendez

customer_reviews.title: This is really a wonderful camera. I had been using a forty year ...
customer_reviews.text: This is really a wonderful camera. I had been using a forty year old SLR Minolta. It has a lot of options and takes a while to get used to, but I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: James M

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: So far I like the camera. I have been happy so far, have only used it for 2 days. Totally satisfied with the order and delivery was exactly as described
customer_reviews.author: Aarin Kenaga

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Takes crystal clear pictures, very impressed. I upgraded from D3300 to D7200.
customer_reviews.author: BevD

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Best camera ever! The pictures are so good. I am just an enthusiast but I take this thing everywhere and photograph everything. I have pictures all over my house because they are so clear when enlarging the prints. Best money you can spend!!
customer_reviews.author: Martecia C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is awesome! The only thing that isnt very apprent is that if you want the gps to work you also need a dongle. It otherwise is fast amd takes sharp and clear photographs.
customer_reviews.author: JasonB

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Got it to replace my old D100. Light years ahead of my old camera. Very nice lens too.
customer_reviews.author: hiflyer

customer_reviews.title: s and this one with larger buffer and a few other change is great, drop a few bucks on a good lens ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two 7100,s and this one with larger buffer and a few other change is great , drop a few bucks on a good lens of choice and bingo you get fantastic photos
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A superb camera
customer_reviews.text: There is absolutely nothing to dislike. A superb camera. The dealer was prompt in filling the order. I am completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: James Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Love the WiFi capability and the ability to pull the ...
customer_reviews.text: This Nikon met every expectation we needed. Love the WiFi capability and the ability to pull the pictures on our iPhones and save them to the photos. A great camera to go with if you have been using entry model SLR cameras and looking to make the next jump in features. Bundled lenses are a great to get this model going right out the box.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rees

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love it and the image quality is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from the D3200 and there is a little bit of a learning curve as this camera has several more features. I absolutely love it and the image quality is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Jill Laudenslager

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and well packaged
customer_reviews.text: It came very well packaged as you can see in the photos. The camera looks amazing with several accessories. Everything looks perfect, and it is the right model D7200. Will complete review when my sister in law uses it. As mentioned in the product details it is only the body so need the len to try it and she is the one who has it. Other than that looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Hansel P.

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal camera
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade or top of the line starter that you won't grow out of for years! Decent multipurpose lens too.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D7200 outstanding performance and quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had Nikon DSLRs since the D40, this is by far the one that I’ve kept the longest, it is that great!
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera! I especially love the way the time-lapse ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera! I especially love the way the time-lapse feature works! And you can take interval still shots, the autofocus is improved, and the dual storage chips is a very nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Erwin

customer_reviews.title: Getting beautiful wildlife shots...
customer_reviews.text: I've had it a little over a day and a half and have taken several hundred pictures. The auto focus works very well - the pictures are in sharp focus.
customer_reviews.author: Rrr Dub

customer_reviews.title: Great low light performance and class leading image quality
customer_reviews.text: This camera is or will be a classic. Great low light performance and class leading image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cartright

customer_reviews.title: Great for the serious hobbyist
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my wife. Seems to be doing everything she wants a camera to do and more. Descendant of the Nikon film camera she learned on. One of the highest rated, high end amateur cameras made. Almost professional quality. Great for the serious hobbyist.
customer_reviews.author: Chess

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this camera is amazing. i use it every single day professionally! fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: Olga Foster

customer_reviews.title: Camera works great, big difference from the nikon d300
customer_reviews.text: Camera works great, big difference from the nikon d300. Faster, more image quality and you can use higher ISO in low light situation. At ISO 1600 the images still look good.
customer_reviews.author: Shani

customer_reviews.title: Getting some amazing images with this camera
customer_reviews.text: Getting some amazing images with this camera. The battery life has been much better than the D3300. Was easy to get set up for wildlife photography.
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: I totally love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I totally love this camera. I had a Nikon D5100 and the quality is night and day between the two models.
customer_reviews.author: JEaston

customer_reviews.title: Quite the camera!
customer_reviews.text: I'm digging in to learn the camera's features. So far I'm very impressed with its capabilities and quality.
customer_reviews.author: CSS

customer_reviews.title: Great camera takes me to a new level.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from the D5500 and what can I say, it's a wonderful camera but after all it's a Nikon. LOL My first outing was a sunrise and July 4th picnic pictures and then for some action a dog lure chase, great pictures of the dogs in motion.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Allen

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my new tool
customer_reviews.text: I am a NatGeo Photo instructor atbtje galapagos islands. I have in my hands the Nikon D7200 and Im very pleased and happy with my new tool, I will Recomend this camera to all our guests and I am very satisfied with tha amazon service, very efficient and just on time.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Saa  Almeida

customer_reviews.title: I love the quality of this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality of this camera, I have not had the chance to use it a lot,because I tend to use other cameras that I am more familiar with , same brand.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Wade

customer_reviews.title: Glad we finally pulled the trigger
customer_reviews.text: Have been tracking this line for awhile. Glad we finally pulled the trigger.
customer_reviews.author: fman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent complete couple!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible sharpness, clarity, contrast DX camera especially paired with Nikon 17-55mm f2.8 lens.
customer_reviews.author: Phuoc Le

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade to the D7100
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade to the D7100, with a larger buffer for RAW files. Very nice crop sensor at 24MP. Is a backup to my backup (D500, D610).
customer_reviews.author: The Reader

customer_reviews.title: Worthy upgrade from the D5000
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera with a lot of useful functions, especially forth advanced photographer. Thought about to upgrade for a while and finally did it. Good decision. I enjoy it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Marosi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera better then a 750 given the Lens range you can fit into it
customer_reviews.author: Rishme Sheriff

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Camera & Lens... A little more complex to learn than I was expecting though.
customer_reviews.author: Ó Baoighill

customer_reviews.title: A Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Camera. Easy to use and it takes great photos. It was delivered on time. It meets and exceeds my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne A. Glass

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, rugged camera! Made for taking pictures of quick moving targets.
customer_reviews.author: Jammas

product_meta.title: Nikon D7200 DX-format DSLR Body (Black)
product_meta.description:
Style:Body Only| Configuration:Base24.2MP DX-Format CMOS Sensor EXPEED 4 Image Processor No Optical Low-Pass Filter 3.2" 1,229k-Dot LCD Monitor Full HD 1080p Video Recording at 60 fps Multi-CAM 3500 II DX 51-Point AF Sensor Native ISO 25600, B&W to ISO 102400

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



Share your creative vision in stunning definition with Nikon's first DSLR to feature built-in Wi-Fi and Near Field Communication (NFC; NFC feature for Android v 4.0 or later smart devices only). A 24.2 megapixel DX-format CMOS image sensor with no optical low-pass filter captures remarkably pure, sharp photos and videos all the way up to ISO 25,600, while EXPEED 4 image processing and Nikon's 51-point autofocus system helps deliver the speed to capture up to 6 fps. Add versatile video features, in-camera time-lapse and creative effects plus outstanding compatibility with the Nikon imaging system, and it's easy to see why the D7200 is the new star of Nikon's DX-format line-up.


For the first time, the exhilarating image quality, low-light capabilities and speed of a Nikon DSLR are available with the convenience of built-in Wi-Fi and Near Field Communication (NFC). Introducing the D7200, the new star of Nikon's DX-format line-up. Bring your creative vision to life with photos and videos that shine with sharpness and clarity. Shoot in nearly any light, from dawn until after dusk, and capture everything from sports and action to wildlife and everyday moments. Then share your beautiful images easier than ever with a compatible smart device. Whether you're a passionate photographer or videographer looking for a tool to ignite your creativity, a pro in need of a nimble second camera or someone looking for an ideal blend of versatility and convenience, the D7200 is ready for your challenge.

TRANSFORM THE ORDINARY
YOUR VISION IN STUNNING DEFINITION
Free of an optical low-pass filter, the D7200 produces remarkably pure, sharp photos and videos. Its 24.2 MP DX-format CMOS image sensor works together with EXPEED 4 image processing and NIKKOR lenses to enhance detail and tonality. This outstanding image quality is maintained all the way up to ISO 25,600 (two full stops higher than the D7200's predecessor) for amazing low-light images. You can also now expand the ISO range up to BW1 (51,200) and BW2 (102,400) to shoot monochromatic photos in even more challenging lighting situations. Whether shooting stills or video, selecting the 1.3x crop mode extends the reach of NIKKOR DX and FX-format lenses, getting you closer to sports, action, wildlife and more.

SHARE EVERY THRILLING CREATION
NIKON'S FIRST DSLR WITH BUILT-IN WI-FI & NFC
Share your outstanding D7200 photos with no hassle, even when on the go. Just touch your compatible* smartphone or tablet with NFC to the D7200 to establish a Wi-Fi connection. Once connected, you can use your smart device to browse photos on the D7200 and then share your favorites by text message, email or posting online. You can also use your smart device as a remote for the D7200; see what the camera sees and take pictures!

CATCH SHOTS OTHERS MIGHT MISS
HIGH-SPEED FRAME RATE AND INCREASED BUFFER
With its 6 fps* shooting capacity, the D7200 is an outstanding choice for sports, wildlife and other fast action. It has a large buffer capacity that can handle up to approx. 100 shots of continuous shooting when in JPEG/fine/large; up to approx. 27 shots in 12-bit lossless compressed RAW or up to approx. 18 shots when using 14-bit lossless compressed RAW and DX-format image size. Switch to 1.3x image size and capture approx. 7 fps* in continuous high-speed mode.
*When using live view, the maximum frame rate will be approx. 3.7 fps.

BEAUTIFULLY RENDERED TIME-LAPSE MOVIES
Record daily life in stunning quality or experiment with new forms of creative expression. Create beautifully rendered time-lapse movies with smooth exposure variations entirely in-camera - a first for Nikon DX-format cameras. Make smooth exposure transitions with Auto ISO while monitoring with Highlight Display (Zebra Stripes). Apply Flat Picture Control for easier color grading in post. Transfer uncompressed footage onto an external recorder with the optional HC-E1 HDMI Cable while recording simultaneously to the internal SD memory card. Use the optional ME-W1 Wireless Microphone and record clear monaural audio from subjects as far as 164ft/50m away, or attach the optional ME-1 Stereo Microphone to the ME-W1 Wireless Microphone's remote unit for stereo recording.

FOCUS ON CHALLENGING SITUATIONS
Whether you're capturing images in daylight or after dusk, the D7200's superb AF system will keep up. Its Advanced Multi-CAM 3500 II autofocus sensor module achieves outstanding focus detection, even at a very dim -3 EV (ISO 100, 20C/68F). Its high-density 51 focus points cover a wide area of the frame in DX format and most of the frame in 1.3x Crop Mode, while 15 cross-type sensors in the center provide higher detection strength. One center AF point even works all the way to f/8, for greater focusing performance when using teleconverters.



SUPPLIED ACCESSORIES
 *  D7200 Body Only 
 *  EN-EL15 Rechargeable Li-ion Battery 
 *  MH-25A Battery Charger 
 *  UC-E17 USB Cable 
 *  AN-DC1 Neck Strap 
 *  DK-5 Eyepiece Cap 
 *  DK-23 Rubber Eyecup 
 *  BF-1B Body Cap
feature_bullets: Built in Wi-Fi and Near Field Communication (NFC) for instant sharing
EXPEED 4 image processing; ISO Sensitivity: ISO 100 - 25,600.Lens mount: Nikon F mount, (with AF coupling and AF contacts)
